indicators.justification:
The Environmental Management Authority of Trinidad and Tobago has a Knowledge Management System (KMS) : Trinidad and Tobago's National Climate Mitigation Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) System Design, is intended to create a centralized repository for information regarding greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions sources, mitigation efforts and resources/support required and received to support their reduction.  (1).  A snapshot of the data is presented on the website.  To access the data online , it is necessary to register with the organization and be approved as a user.  Registered users can also go into the office to view the data.  

Source:
(1)the Environmental Management Agency. https://www.ema.co.tt/our-environment/kms/

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
Nationally published data includes detailed information on greenhouse gas emissions and targets reported to the UNFCCC.
Data contains detailed information on sources of greenhouse gas emissions.
Emissions data includes, or site where emissions data is made available links to, details of land use effects on emissions.
The dataset contains unique identifiers for greenhouse gas emissions that allow easy assessment across inventories, reduction commitments, and sources.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

indicators.justification:
Biodiversity in Trinidad and Tobago  information on endangered species and ecosystems available as data but can be seen on different data bases or websites (1),  depending on the subject matter.  There is the endangered species list (Environmentally Sensitive Species (ESSs) (1)  It is part of Trinidad and Tobago's Biodiversity Clearing House Mechanism. Additionally there is a list of reptiles (2), and amphibians (3).

Sources:
1.Environmentally Sensitive Species (ESSs. http://www.biodiversity.gov.tt/home/protected-areas-and-species/environmentally-sensitive-species-ess.html
2.List of REPTILIA species in Trinidad & Tobago. https://rainforests.mongabay.com/biodiversity/en/trinidad_&_tobago/REPTILIA.html
3. List of AMPHIBIA species in Trinidad & Tobago. https://rainforests.mongabay.com/biodiversity/en/trinidad_&_tobago/AMPHIBIA.html

indicators.justification:
Weather data in Trinidad and Tobago is posted the Weather Centres' website  (1) where one can find information on weather, earthquake and other natural hazard information.  At the Met Office(2) website one can find weather observations, forecasts, warnings and climate information.  and its Facebook page (3) gives various synopsis of Met Office work.

Source:
1.  The weather Centre.  https://ttweathercenter.com
2. The Met Office.  https://www.metoffice.gov.tt
3. Met Office Facebook.  https://www.facebook.com/TTMetService/photos/a.271989316250626/4090270247755828

indicators.justification:
1. Like in many other countries, with the advent of Covid-19  non-essential workers in Trinidad and Tobago had to stay at home, this affected availability many governmental services. (1)
2. As part of the e-government initiative the government of Trinidad and Tobago have instituted an Online company registry. (2)

Source:
1.  Preliminary Overview of the Economies of Latin America and the Caribbean ▪ 2020.  https://repositorio.cepal.org/bitstream/handle/11362/46504/77/PO2020_TrinidadAndTobago_en.pdf
2.  Online Company Registry Search Page.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt

evidence.title: Preliminary Overview of the Economies of Latin America and the Caribbean ▪ 2020

indicators.justification:
This structured  data is found in the company registry (1) However when an initial search is undertaken, the information received is a list of companies with the key word in their name.  To receive full access there is a fee to be paid.   Availability of requested information was affected by workers staying home due to Covid-19, hence hindering the quick turnaround of information required from governmental agencies.

1. Online Registry Search Function. https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt
2. Preliminary Overview of the Economies of Latin America and the Caribbean 2020,   Trinidad and Tobago.  https://repositorio.cepal.org/bitstream/handle/11362/46504/77/PO2020_TrinidadAndTobago_en.pdf

evidence.title: ECLA report indicating Workers Stayed at Home

indicators.justification:
In Trinidad and Tobago birth and death information is available at the Central Statistical Office (1) while the Registrar General handles information on birth, death and marriages.

The Central Statistical Office  publishes Vital Statistics (1) which comprises of Births, Deaths, Marriages and Divorces.  However much of that information is not current.  At the Registrar General Civil Registry one can apply for certificates concerning  births, marriages and deaths but none of the information is available online.


Source:
1. Vital Statistics.  https://cso.gov.tt/subjects/population-and-vital-statistics/vital-statistics/
2. Registrar General Civil Registry.  https://agla.gov.tt/registrar-general/registrar-general-civil-registry/

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?

Cause of death is standardized to the International Classification of Causes of Death (ICD) or a related, fully interoperable standard.
Mortality information includes data about age, sex and/or gender, geographic location, and cause of death.
Birth information includes data about sex and/or assigned gender of child, gestational age, and birth weight.
Birth information includes data about live-birth order and interval between last and previous live births to mother.
Birth information includes data about place of occurrence, place of usual residence of mother, and month of occurrence.
Birth information includes data about place of registration and month of registration.
Birth information includes data about age, educational attainment, and ethnic and/or national group of mother.
Birth information includes data about age of father and place of usual residence.
Birth information includes data about site of delivery, attendant at birth, and month in which prenatal care began.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.

indicators.justification:
During the period under consideration, Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of health has been giving daily Covid-19 updates (1).   Tobago gives a separate update (2) from Trinidad.  There is a Dashboard (3)  provided by the ministry that shows many aspects of COVID-19 data that the public uses to inform itself.

Sources:
1. Covid Updates.  https://health.gov.tt/covid-19/covid-19-news-and-updates/update-trinidad-and-tobago
2. Tobago Covid Updates.  https://trha.co.tt/alpha/covid-19/
3. Ministry of health Trinidad and Tobago, Covid Dashboard.  https://experience.arcgis.com/experience/59226cacd2b441c7a939dca13f832112/

evidence.title: Ministry of health Trinidad and Tobago, Covid Dashboard

indicators.justification:
As noted, COVID-19 Updates(1) regularly takes place. On the website of the Ministry of Health there are all the Health facilities (2) that are involved in COVID-19 for bed, or vaccines or ICUs.  There are also mass vaccination sites (3) and official list of who should be vaccinated (3) posted on the websites.

Sources

1. Covid Updates.   https://health.gov.tt/covid-19/covid-19-news-and-updates/update-trinidad-and-tobago
2. Health Facilities.  https://health.gov.tt/health-facilities
3. TT Launches Mass Vaccination Sites.  https://health.gov.tt/covid-19/covid-19-news-and-updates/tt-launches-mass-vaccination-sites
4. Who Should Get the COVID-19 Vaccine.   https://health.gov.tt/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine/who-should-get

indicators.justification:
With the attempt at eGovernment (1) to make information and services available to the public, Land use information  is available through a government portal (2).  It does however fall under the purview of Town and Country Planning (3).  the following is noted: 
1. There are no entries concerning land use of the open data portal.  However, data can be found on the Town and Country Planning Website. 
2. The standardized lands dictionary is seen on the maps when they are manipulated.
3. Forested areas are  observed by clicking on the policy tab.
4.  Protect areas are seen by toggling the policy grid.
5. Geospatial reference is seen by toggling the castaral grid

Sources:
1.  Government of Trinidad and Tobago Select e-Services Portal Government of Trinidad and Tobago.  https://www.developtt.gov.tt/ttacps_appl/mvvmc/eservices/acpsPublicService.tcpdPortalSelectEService
2.  Town and Country Planning Division. https://tcpd.gov.tt

evidence.title: Government of Trinidad and Tobago Select e-Services Portal Government of Trinidad and Tobago.

indicators.justification:
Land tenure in Trinidad and Tobago is under the purview of Office of the Attorney General and Ministry of Legal Affairs (1) On the home page there is a link to "Land Registry Online (2)".  However, the link leads to a the following message: HTTP Error 404.0 - Not Found. The resource you are looking for has been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.  The data is not accessible as of July 4th, 2021 and later attempts (3).

Source
1.  Ministry of Legal affairs website: (agla.gov.tt).
2.  land Registry Link: http://legalaffairs.gov.tt/Land/PIMS_main.html
3. 404 unavailable web information. http://legalaffairs.gov.tt/Land/PIMS_main.html

evidence.title: Office of the Attorney general and Ministry of Legal Affairs  website

indicators.justification:
A comprehensive set of Trinidad and Tobago Governmental budgetary information are readily available online for various year,  September 14 2001 - October 5, 2020. Included in these budgetary reports are 2021 Estimates of Expenditure (1), Statutory Boards Revenue and Expenditure (2), Recurrent Expenditure (3), Development Expenditure and 2020 Supplementary Appropriation (4) and Mid Year Review (5).  These to give a holistic picture of governmental budgetary activities as they relate to data.

Source:
1. 2021 Estimates of Expenditure. https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Estimates-of-Expenditure-for-the-Financial-Year-2021.pdf
2.  Statutory Boards Revenue and Expenditure.  https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Estimates-of-Statutory-Boards-2021.pdf
3. Recurrent Expenditure.  https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Estimates-of-Recurrent-Expenditure-2021.pdf
4. Development Expenditure. https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Public-Sector-Investment-Programme.pdf
5.  2020 Supplementary Appropriation and Mid-Year Review. https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Supplementary-Appropriation-and-Mid-Year-Review-Statement-2020.pdf

evidence.title: 2020 SUPPLEMENTARY APPROPRIATION AND MID YEAR REVIEW

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
There is structured data available on the executive budget proposal in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data available on amended budgets (when applicable) or amendments of the enacted budget.
There is structured data available on the approved or enacted budget in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about government budget execution or spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis, including spending in annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about the government's extrabudgetary funds spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about the government's social security spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about public corporations' spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
Budget entries have administrative classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have economic classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have functional classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have program classifications according to an internationally agreed standard.
Information about individual financial transactions or expenditures is available at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification level.
Data is disaggregated by cross-cutting programs, or issues such as SDGs, climate action, gender budgeting, etc,
The data contains common identifiers to connect budget and budget performance data.
The data contains identifiers that can be used to connect budget data with data on major projects (e.g., infrastructure construction) and procurement processes.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

indicators.justification:
Transparency and lack of corruption in the award of public contracts (1) in Trinidad and Tobago has  been an ongoing initiative of the current government.  The Central Tenders Board (2) is the unit in charge of all aspects of tender notices (3) including the tender for consulting services (4).   
It is the aim of the government to ensure that data is available to the public so that lack of corruption and full transparency can be achieved.

indicators.justification:
Despite the fact that the GoRTT Open Data Portal (1) shows a high degree of inactivity, The National ICT Plan (2) was designed by the government of Trinidad and Tobago to serve as a blue print or strategic initiative for the period 2018-2022 and demonstrates policy commitment at the highest levels of government towards data use.  Additionally there has been hackathons (3) 
supported by the Government and the University of the West Indies through a memorandum of understanding ,in 2019,  that demonstrate a willingness to partake in open data in the country (4). 

Sources:
1. GoRTT Open Data Portal. https://data.gov.tt
2.  ICT BLUEPRINT 2018-2022, National ICT Plan 2018-2022. https://www.mpa.gov.tt/publications/NICT%20Plan%202018-2022
3. Hackathon to explore transport solutions to gender-based violence. https://newsday.co.tt/2021/04/25/hackathon-to-explore-transport-solutions-to-gender-based-violence/
4. iGovTT and UWI sign MOU to host hackathon. http://www.news.gov.tt/content/igovtt-and-uwi-sign-mou-host-hackathon#.YUIkRS2963U

indicators.justification:
There is some, albeit small, evidence of open data in Trinidad and Tobago.  The Open Data Portal (1) is still present even though there is a limited data set and hardly any changes.  Trinidad & Tobago was rejected (2) from the Open Government Partnership for lack of a plan towards data despite the fact that a major policy document of the country shows commitment to open data from the highest level of Government (3)  (page 92. #1.5).

Sources:
1.  GoRTT Open Data Portal. https://data.gov.tt/about
2. Open Government Partnership Rescinds Trinidad and Tobago's Membership.  https://www.opengovpartnership.org/news/open-government-partnership-rescinds-trinidad-and-tobagos-membership/
3.  Vision 2030. https://www.planning.gov.tt/sites/default/files/Vision%202030-%20The%20National%20Development%20Strategy%20of%20Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%202016-2030.pdf

indicators.justification:
Trinidad and Tobago has a draft policy for Local Government Reform (1) with the aim of facilitating participatory local government management. ICT is supposed to play a critical role to facilitate easy and effective information collection, storage and dissemination (Page 36.) There is also the mention of a Complaint Management Software that will require gathering, storing using and reusing of data. Despite the draft policy there is no evidence of activities at the local governmental level (2). However, at the national level there is the Central Statistical Office (3) that demonstrates institutional capacity to handle data.

Sources:
(1) GoRTT Transitioning of Local Government, Draft Policy.
https://rdlg.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/Draft-Policy-on-Local-Government-Reform-08-03-17.pdf
(2) Trinidad and Tobago Association of Local Government Authorities, Facebook Page.  https://www.facebook.com/Trinidad-and-Tobago-Association-of-Local-Government-Authorities-386372844750417/
Shows the CSO data capability
3. Central Statistical Office.  https://cso.gov.tt/methods/classifications/

Face Book page of Trinidad and Tobago Association of Local Government Authorities Government Organization

indicators.justification:
The Public Service Academy (PSA) offers training services to Public Officers.  This service is offered through the Public Service Academy.   A roster of training courses for March 2021 to May 2021 shows no training courses pertaining to data (1).

Training statistics for 2019-2020 highlight that no data related courses were delivered (2).

Some civil servants are given time off and sabbaticals to attend courses of their choosing at The University of the West Indies. This can include data courses. Data education and training programmes exist through the University of the West Indies in 'Foundations of Data Management and Analysis' and Certificate in Fundamentals of Statistical Analysis Techniques (3) and (4). 
The UWI St. Augustine Campus has a MSc. Data Science (5 ).

 Sources

1. Public Service Academy Learning Activities March to May 2021.   https://mpadt.gov.tt/sites/default/files/file_upload/psacourses/PSA%20Learning%20Activities%20March%20-%20May%202021.pdf
2. Ministry of Public Administration and Digital Transformation, Public Service Training. https://mpadt.gov.tt/Training%20For%20Public%20Officers
3. The University of the West Indies, Open Campus, Foundations of Data Management and Analysis.  https://open.uwi.edu/programmes/foundations-data-management-and-analysis
4. The University of the West Indies, Open Campus,Fundamentals Of Statistical Analysis Techniques.  http://208.131.174.203/programmes/fundamentals-statistical-analysis-techniques
5.  UWI.  The St Agustine Campus, Department of Computing & Information Technology, MSc. Data Science.  https://sta.uwi.edu/fst/dcit/programmes/pg-DataScience

indicators.justification:
The law governing companies in Trinidad and Tobago is the Companies Act (1).  It covers all of Trinidad and Tobago and pertains to all approved organizations that are (a) incorporated under this Act;(b) formed under some other written law; or 
(c) a partnership.  (1).  There is an Online Registry (2) where users can apply for information about companies.

The National Policy on Persons with Disabilities, represents a strategic commitment by the Ministry to ensure equality and equity in the provision and development of plans and services to the community of persons with disabilities. indicators.justification:
Data management and publication is critical to understanding Trinidad and Tobago's approach to data ownership and sharing.  There are four (4) documents which demonstrates the approach. 

The National ICT Blue Print (1) is a supporting document to the previously discussed Vision 2030 document and provide strategic thrusts for that the country will emulate.

Data Protection Act (2011)(2) shows how data will be treated while trying to protect the rights of individuals in the country. Privacy is one of the corner stones of the Act.  It provides guidelines for both the individual and organizations holding information.
 
Data priorities are seen in the Vision 2030 document (3)  It builds upon the goals and achievements of Vision 2020 document and outlines a series of strategic policy initiatives to guide Trinidad and Tobago until 2030.

The Central Statistical Office CSO (4) is an arm of the government in charge of Data collection, Data processing and  Data Dissemination. It shows the institutional capacity of government to handle data.

Sources:
1.   ICT Blue Print, National Plan 2018 -2022. https://www.mpa.gov.tt/publications/NICT%20Plan%202018-2022
2.   Data Protection Act, Chapter 22:04. https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/22.04.pdf
3. Government of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, Vision 2030.  https://www.planning.gov.tt/sites/default/files/Vision%202030-%20The%20National%20Development%20Strategy%20of%20Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%202016-2030.pdf
4. Central Statistical Office.  https://cso.gov.tt/methods/classifications/

evidence.title: Trinidad and Tobago’s National ICT Plan ICT Blueprint 2018 – 2022.
The Government of the Republiclic of Trinidad and Tobago, VISION 2030 NATIONAL DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY 2016 - 2030

responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
There are minimum standards for metadata when government data is catalogued or published.
There is a standardised process for publishing and updating published government data.
There are technical standards, including common data models, codelists, and identifiers for management and publication of government data.
There are clearly documented quality control processes for government data.
There are clearly documented processes for soliciting and integrating feedback from external users to improve data quality.

indicators.justification:
The framework is architectured by three main Acts and therefore has the full force of the law.   This is evidenced by:

 The Data Protection  Act, 2011 (1), aims to ensure that individuals are protected through rights  to privacy and the right to maintain sensitive personal information as private and personal.

2.  The National ICT Act (2) is a strategic plan to change the countries ICT approach by empowering  people, businesses, government.

3. The Freedom of Information Act (3) seeks to extend the rights of the public in Trinidad and Tobago to access information held by public authorities in the country.

Sources:
1.  Data Protection Act, Chapter 22:04. https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/22.04.pdf
2. ICT Blue Print, National Plan 2018 -2022. https://www.mpa.gov.tt/publications/NICT%20Plan%202018-2022
3.  Freedom of Information Act, Chapter 22:02.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/alphabetical_list/lawspdfs/22.02.pdf

responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework covers data sharing within government.
The framework covers how government should share data with other sectors.
The framework covers data sharing from other sectors to government.
The framework covers data sharing within the private sector.
The framework explicitly focuses on artificial intelligence uses of data.

indicators.justification:
The Data protection Act of 2011 (1) provides a robust framework for Data Protection of individuals in Trinidad and Tobago.  It was legitimized in 2012 (2), and since then has been the governing legislation.   

With the advent of Covid-19 the government found it necessary to move away from the Act by publishing data of Individuals who were affected by the disease.  It fact,  a list of persons purportedly under quarantine, together with their personal contact information, was widely circulated on social media. This contradicted the common law principles of confidentiality, and doctor-patient confidentiality in particular (3). To support this move away from the Act, The Public Health [2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)] (No. 8) Regulations, 2020  regulation  was proclaimed (4).

Sources:
1. Data protection Act, 2011.  Chapter  22:04.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/22.04.pdf
2. Legal Notice No. 2. Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, No. 2 of 2012.  http://www.ttparliament.org/legislations/ln2012-02.pdf
3.  COVID-19, Privacy and Data Protection. http://trinidadlaw.com/covid-19-privacy-and-data-protection/
4. The Public Health [2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)] (No. 8) Regulations, 2020. https://www.ttlawcourts.org/index.php/component/attachments/download/7065

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework provides data subjects with rights of choice or consent.
The framework provides data subjects with rights to access and correct data about themselves.
The framework sets out clear responsibilities for data holders.
The framework provides rights of redress
The framework requires data controllers to notify an appropriate authority of data breaches.
Frameworks explicitly cover the protection of location-related data.
The framework addresses algorithmic decision making.
Exceptions to the usual data protection framework have been made as part of the country's COVID-19 response.

responses.response_text: The framework applies widely across all sectors (including public and private sector).

responses.response_text: The framework assessed, or equivalent frameworks, apply across the whole country.
responses.subquestion_text: Does this framework apply across the whole country?

indicators.justification:
To deal with data that is pertinent to the government the central statistical office was created.  The Statistics Act (1) sanctioned the establishment of the Central Statistical Office which further demonstrates the institutional legitimacy and capacity to handle data in Trinidad and Tobago.    

TT Connect (2) is a move towards e-government where various governmental; documents are available  or can be applied for online at various ministries.  The site states that English is the official language. All responses are based on the English language only and there are no mandates to provide accessibility to non-English speakers in the frameworks being referred.

indicators.justification:
In the The Open Data Inventory (ODIN) 2020 Trinidad ranked 172nd out of 185 in the Open Data Inventory 2020 (1)  The supporting evidence highlights this fact.

Open Government Partnership (OGP)is a multilateral initiative that aims to secure concrete commitments from national and subnational governments to promote open government, empower citizens, fight corruption, and harness new technologies to strengthen governance. Trinidad and Tobago is not a participant.

2.  Open Data Charter (ODC)The ODC is a collaboration between over 100 governments and organisations working to open up data based on a shared set of seven principles. Trinidad and Tobago Trinidad and Tobago has not adopted the charter.  Trinidad & Tobago lost its OGP membership status in 2019, due to failure to deliver an action plan since 2016 (2).

The Open Data Portal (3) shows the lack of an Action Plan and lack of activities.

National data strategies or National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) provide a country with a strategy for developing statistical capacity across the entire national statistical system (NSS). It presents the statistical  priorities for the next 5-10 years.Trinidad and Tobago does not have a national data strategy.    This is reflected in the Open Data sources (4).

VISION 2030 NATIONAL DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY 2016 - 2030 (5).
One of the strategic initiatives is :Under the International Open Government Partnership commitments for example, Government is expected to implement a National Open Data Strategy component, which will facilitate the development of ICT platforms to enable dialogue between Government and the general public . This is shown in the Vision 2030 document.

Sources:
1. Open Data Inventory 2020-2021.  https://odin.opendatawatch.com/ReportCreator/ExportCountryReport/TTO/2020
2. Open Government Partnership Rescinds Trinidad and Tobago's Membership. https://www.opengovpartnership.org/news/open-government-partnership-rescinds-trinidad-and-tobagos-membership/
3.  GoRTT Open Data Portal.  https://data.gov.tt
4. Open Government Data Sources. https://www.ttconnect.gov.tt/gortt/portal/ttconnect/!ut/p/a1/jdDBDoIwDAbgp-FKC8tUvHFARUwMGBV2MWjmwCAjY4KPL3ozKNpbm-9P_hQYxMDKtMlFqnNZpsVzZ6NDENpIfYfgOkQH7ci3PKQBmY9JB5I3EM1nHfCotQh2BBH_y-OXcX_mN7yEPbBBtqQ90K_5AgM9lsBEIY-vnyRueSQTAUzxM1dcmTfVnTOtq3pqoIFt25pCSlFw8ySvBn6KZLLWEL9LqK7b-O5faNGs3AdjOzzp/dl5/d5/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/?https://www.ttconnect.gov.tt/gortt/portal/ttconnect/!ut/p/a1/jdDBDoIwDAbgp-FKC8tUvHFARUwMGBV2MWjmwCAjY4KPL3ozKNpbm-9P_hQYxMDKtMlFqnNZpsVzZ6NDENpIfYfgOkQH7ci3PKQBmY9JB5I3EM1nHfCotQh2BBH_y-OXcX_mN7yEPbBBtqQ90K_5AgM9lsBEIY-vnyRueSQTAUzxM1dcmTfVnTOtq3pqoIFt25pCSlFw8ySvBn6KZLLWEL9LqK7b-O5faNGs3AdjOzzp/dl5/d5/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/?WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/gortt/wcm/connect/GorTT+Web+Content/TTConnect/Citizen/Topic/InformationandStatistics/General+Information/Links+to+Open+Government+Data+SourcesWCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/gortt/wcm/connect/GorTT+Web+Content/TTConnect/Citizen/Topic/InformationandStatistics/General+Information/Links+to+Open+Government+Data+Sources.

responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework establishes a common definition of open data.
The framework promotes open licensing without any restrictions beyond attribution and share-alike.
The framework requires to publish data in machine readable formats.
The rules/guidance requires the use of specific data standards.
The framework promotes training and capacity building among government officials.

responses.response_text: The relevant laws, policies and guidance assessed cover the majority of localities and government agencies.
responses.subquestion_text: How widely do these laws, regulations, policies or guidance apply?

indicators.justification:
The budget is the law which guides yearly spending in Trinidad and Tobago (1). There is a constitutional mandate under section 113-1 of the Constitution (2,) which states that the budget must be presented before or no later than 30 days after the commencement of each financial year, estimates of revenue and expenditure for that year. Circular calls help with the establishment of the budget (3)through the collection of information from various ministries. The implementation of the budget is guided by the EXCHEQUER AND AUDIT ACT CHAPTER 69:01 (4.). However, none of these laws surveyed dealt with publication of data. The Open Budget Survey Report (5) showed the Trinidad and Tobago ranked 90th of 117 countries its last assessment.

Sources:
(1) GoRTT Budget Statement 2021.  https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Budget-Statement-2021-1.pdf
(2)  Trinidad and Tobago Act No. 4 of 1976.  http://laws.gov.tt/pdf/Act1976_4.pdf
(3)Call Circular 02, dated March 24, 2021. https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/Minister-of-Finance-Call-Circular-No.-2-dated-March-24-2021.pdf
(4)The Exchequer and Audit Act, Chapter 69:01.  https://www.finance.gov.tt/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/The-Exchequer-and-Audit-Act.pdf
(5)Open Budget Survey Report.  https://stories.tteiti.com/budget-guide/index.html

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: There is no mention of data or the publication of data in relevant laws, policies, or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
Summary reports must be provided as structured data.
Expenditure information at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification must be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require executive budget proposal information to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require the approved or enacted budget to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require in-year reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance require year-end reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
1. The Integrity in Public Life Act (1) is the governing legislation to which  public officials must adhere in Trinidad and Tobago.  One of its major thrust is to provide transparency to public officials.  The Act along with the Data Protection Act (2) call for information to be collected on government officials.

Sources:
1.  The  Integrity in Public Life Act.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/alphabetical_list/lawspdfs/22.01.pdf
2. The Data Protection Act (2011), Chapter 22:04.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/22.04.pdf

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: There is no mention of data or the publication of data in relevant laws, policies, or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework requires collecting specific information on assets and liabilities.
The framework requires collecting specific information on in-kind and non-financial support.
The framework requires collecting information on significant changes in assets and liabilities.
The framework requires disclosure of income and assets held by a public official's spouse, family members, or other intimates.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The framework requires the publication of income and asset declarations.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification: Even though lobbying, as defined by  the question guidance, takes place, it is not an official part of the Trinidad and Tobago's political system and hence no official or legal lobbying structure in the country.

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: There is no mention of data or the publication of data in relevant laws, policies, or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework contains clear and unambiguous definitions of lobbyists, lobbying clients, lobbying activities, and public officials.
The framework requires the collection and publication of the identities of lobbyists, lobbyist clients, and public officials who engage with lobbyists.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on lobbyists' goals for lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on timing of lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on topics of lobbying activities.
The framework requires the collection and publication of information on how much money is spent on lobbying activities.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
THE REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE ACT CHAPTER 2:01 (1) is the guiding law that covers election.   It is important to note that there has been a proposed amendment entitled THE REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2020 (2), it  was proposed last year to amend the deficiencies in the law (3),  and it  is before Parliament . 

Sources:
(1) The Representation of the People's Act Ch 2:01.   https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/2.01.pdf
2.  The Representation of the People (Amendment Bill, 2020 Explanatory Note.   http://www.ttparliament.org/legislations/b2020h07.pdf
3. Government Targets Campaign Finance Reform.   https://trinidadexpress.com/newsextra/government-targets-campaign-finance-reform/article_8ab8d352-915f-11ea-9d9f-d3bc55bb0b9d.html

indicators.justification:
Public consultation does take place in the course of law making (1), however, there is no specific Act mandating it.  This lack of a  specific legal framework was verified in an IADB public consultation document (2) on page 26.   The document did highlight laws  which various authorities use including the Environmental Management Act (3)  which was found to legislate consultation within the framework of Environmental management.

Sources:
1.  The Process of Lawmaking.  http://www.ttparliament.org/publications.php?mid=66
(2) Public Consultation Step by Step: Regulatory and Legal Framework Applicable to Trinidad and Tobago.  https://publications.iadb.org/publications/english/document/Public-Consultations-Step-by-Step-Regulatory-and-Legal-Frameworks-Applicable-in-Trinidad-and-Tobago.pdf
(3 )The Environmental Management Act, Chapter 35:05.  https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/alphabetical_list/lawspdfs/35.05.pdf.   Articles: 27; 28; 29; 35.5; 36; 69.2.

evidence.title: IADB Public Consultation Step by Step

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: Requirements to publish data are set out in binding policy, regulations, or law.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework requires the publication of notice of intent in advance of public consultation processes.
The framework requires the publication of proposed regulations.
The framework requires the timely publication of a full set of public comments generated through public consultation processes.
The framework requires reasoned responses to be published alongside comments.
The framework requires the publication of final regulations and justification.
The framework requires the publication of challenges to laws and regulations that have undergone public consultation processes, as well as their results.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
The Freedom of Information Act provides a basis for data collection and publishing on the performance of rights to information  / or freedom of Information (1.) To carry out the Act, the Freedom of Information unit was formed thus having institutional capacity and authority to ensure that the goals of the act is successful.

Source:
(1)The Freedom of Information Act.   https://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/alphabetical_list/lawspdfs/22.02.pdf
2.  The Freedom of Information Unit.  http://www.foia.gov.tt

The framework requires the collection and publication of data regarding appeals to RTI determinations and their results.
The framework requires that information is linked to the relevant agency, department, or other governmental entity.

The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.

indicators.justification: I reviewed newspaper articles, external development agencies, civil society organizations, company websites and news, along with government departments' websites but found no evidence of this data being used to support due diligence.

responses.response_text: There is no evidence of such products or services in the country.

There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, government.

There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, media.

indicators.justification:
There is widespread evidence of statistics and policy  use to influence outcomes.  A government planner notes she employs  land-use statistics to influence policy aimed at women (1). The University of the West Indies St. Augustine, employs  land-use statistics to teach about women and land use in Trinidad and Tobago (2).

Sources:
1. Using Landuse Policy to influence Planning.  https://paris21.org/news-center/news/planning-ahead-gender-statistics-leave-no-one-behind-trinidad-and-tobago
2.Land use statistics employed in teaching.    https://sta.uwi.edu/conferences/11/landtenure/documents/JulianaJohan-BoodramGenderPovertyLandRightsPowerpoint.pdf

evidence.title: Using Landuse Policy to influence Planning
Land use statistics employed in teaching

responses.response_text: There are isolated cases of actors or entities using this kind of data to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use?
There is evidence of civil society organizations using data in this way.
There is evidence of media using data in this way.
There is evidence of academics using data in this way.
There is evidence of the private sector using data in this way.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
Is there evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts on land policy?

indicators.justification:
It is a well known fact that in many countries various types of corruption takes place within the elections sphere.  In many instances bribery and campaign financing data has been used to measure corruption (1).  Such topics have been reported in media(2).

Source:
1.  Political Integrity Lacking in Latin America and the Caribbean, Especially Around Elections.  https://www.transparency.org/en/news/political-integrity-lacking-in-latin-america-and-the-caribbean-especially-a
2.  Calls to halt role of money in politics As T&T's corruption perception worsens....   https://trinidadexpress.com/business/local/calls-to-halt-role-of-money-in-politics/article_38ec52d8-3e3f-11ea-8edb-c31b99759604.html

responses.response_text: There are isolated cases of actors or entities using this kind of data for accountability purposes, though the source may not be open data.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used for accountability purposes?
Civil society organizations regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The media regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
Scholars or academic institutions regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The private sector regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.

indicators.justification:
The Government of Trinidad and Tobago, as is the case in many countries, is the single largest procurer of goods, works and services. In Trinidad and Tobago there is support for  environmental procurement (1) by the Government.   The Office of Procurement Regulation (2) has been tasked with ensuring the goal is achieved.  The Office of Procurement Regulation is a body corporate established pursuant to an Act of Parliament, namely the Public Procurement and Disposal of Public Property Act, 2015. 

Source:
1.  Achieving sustainability through public procurement: A utopian idea?.   https://energynow.tt/blog/achieving-sustainability-through-public-procurement-a-utopian-idea
2. https://oprtt.org/who-we-are-3

responses.response_text: There is evidence of isolated uses or pilot projects.
responses.subquestion_text: To what extent is there evidence of this kind of data use?
There is evidence of government procurement data being presented through data-driven dashboards.
There is evidence of government procurement data being used for red flag analysis.
There is evidence that government procurement data is being analyzed to improve access to procurement opportunities for marginalized groups.
There is evidence of government procurement data being analysed to support sustainable / environmental procurement.
There are examples of government using data in these ways.
There are examples of civil society using data in these ways.
There is evidence of private sector using data in this way
At least one of the examples cited appears to make use of open procurement data.
At least one of the examples identified makes use of open beneficial ownership data.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.
